name: Monitoring
description: The process of measuring application performance, availability and user experience and using this data to identify and resolve application issues before they impact customers

components.name: Logs and Metrics
components.definition: logs and metrics from all components can be accessed from a central location

criteria.name: logs and metrics are generated on applications/components but are not automaticallys collected into a central place
logs and metrics are collected into a shared location known to the squad/team but aren't accessible by the group tools
logs and metrics from all components are collected in the group logging and monitoring tools where they can be analysed

components.name: Issue detection/alert generation
components.definition: tools are used to analyse the logs so that issues can be identified across multiple components and alerts automatically raised

criteria.name: searching for issues is done on adhoc basis e.g. manually grepping through logs
teams/squads have their own techniques for identifying issues which aren't integrated with the group's operational procedures
the groups tools are used and have been configured so that alerts are automatically raised and fed into the groups operational procedures
the ongoing effectiveness of the log analysis is measured to ensure that issues are being detected
when new issues are recognised, group tools are reconfigured to raise new alerts

components.name: Dashboard
components.definition: log entries, metrics and alert are displayed in a centralised location where they can be effectively managed

criteria.name: teams have their own ways of presenting monitoring, alert and metrics, which aren't integrated with the group's operational procedures
all monitoring, alerts and metrics from all applications/components can be viewed and managed from a single dashboard in group tools

components.name: Tracing
components.definition: the path of user requests/messages should be easy to follow through all components so that issues can be more easily understood and resolved

criteria.name: applications/components have their own unique request identifiers which are not passed between components

All user requests/messages have a unique identifier that is kept and logged as the request moves between components . alternately in very high volume systems it is possible to turn on the generation of a unique identifier for a subset of requets for a limited time

components.name: Implementation
components.definition:
applications/components must be developed with sufficient logging and metrics for them to be supportable
. There should be standards that govern and guide developers in what must be done.
Where third party components or services are used these should integrate and allow aggregation into common monitoring solutions.

criteria.name: developers add some logging and monitoring to applications but it is not comprehensive nor done by all squad/team members
teams/squads have created their own approach but this may not be comprehensive and won't integrate with group tools so support will be dfiicult and deficient

developers follow  group-wide standards and guidelines that help developers recognise what logging and monitoring needs to be inplace in applications in order to for those applications to be supportable

components.name: Non-functional testing
components.definition: monitoring and alerting and metrics are tested to ensure that the platform/system remains supportable

criteria.name: DE.DP-5: Detection processes are continuously improved
DE.CM-1: The network is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
DE.DP-1: Roles and responsibilities for detection are well defined to ensure accountability
DE.CM-2: The physical environment is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
DE.CM-3: Personnel activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
DE.CM-4: Malicious code is detected
DE.CM-5: Unauthorized mobile code is detected
DE.DP-2: Detection activities comply with all applicable requirements
DE.DP-3: Detection processes are tested
DE.CM-6: External service provider activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events
DE.CM-7: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed
DE.CM-8: Vulnerability scans are performed
DE.DP-4: Event detection information is communicated
